thread.title: New York Concert Promoter Sentenced to Prison for Ticket Ponzi Scheme

author: Maria Armental
title: New York Concert Promoter Sentenced to Prison for Ticket Ponzi Scheme
text:
A New York concert promoter accused of bilking investors in a Ponzi-like scheme involving Broadway hit shows like “Hamilton” was sentenced to 6 1/2 years in prison and ordered to pay back more than $100 million.
Joseph Meli, 43 years old, was also sentenced Tuesday in Manhattan federal court to three years of supervised release, while co-defendant Steven Simmons was sentenced to 37 months in prison and ordered to forfeit $6.9 million, including a house he bought in Wilton, Conn.
